meanings.definition: To seal (a bottle) with a cork again.
meanings.sent1: After enjoying a glass of wine, she carefully recorked the bottle to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: I always recork the wine bottle after pouring a glass to preserve its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The wine bottle felt relieved when it was recorked, knowing it would stay fresh.
meanings.sent4: Recorking the bottle was like giving it a hug, keeping its contents safe and secure.
meanings.sent5: Recorking is like putting a blanket over the bottle, keeping it cozy and protected.

meanings.definition: The act of sealing a bottle with a cork again.
meanings.sent1: The recorking of the wine bottle was necessary to maintain its freshness.
meanings.sent2: I always make sure to do the recorking immediately after pouring a glass of wine.
meanings.sent3: The recorking process seemed like a little dance between the bottle and the cork.
meanings.sent4: The recorking of the bottle was a silent promise to keep its contents safe.
meanings.sent5: The recorking added an extra layer of protection to the precious wine inside.
